item.title: The Power of the Joseph Smith Translation
item.description: Elder Neal A. Maxwell illustrates how the Joseph Smith Translation gives us increased knowledge of Heavenly Father's work and glory.

item.title: In The Image of God
item.description: This presentation teaches that we can see our eternal potential by remembering that we are children of God.

item.title: Leading by Example
item.description: The righteous example of a young woman helps a friend become converted to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley counsels youth to marry in the covenant.

item.title: Animal Sacrifice and the Atonement
item.description: A modern father teaches his son about the relationship between the ancient practice of animal sacrifice and the atoning sacrifice of Jesus Christ.

item.description: The invisible poison of carbon monoxide is compared to the danger of worshiping modern idols. President Ezra Taft Benson counsels us to put God first in our lives.

item.description: An Arabian stallion's obedience is tested in a time of hunger and thirst.

item.description: Hannah shows her faithfulness by lending her son to the Lord.

item.title: "The Lord... Will Deliver Me"
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about the story of David volunteering to fight Goliath.

item.title: Ancient Temples
item.description: A visual tour of a representation of Moses' tabernacle helps us understand temple worship and the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Trusting in the Lord
item.description: The story of a young skier who decides to follow his guide illustrates the principle taught in Proverbs 3:5-6.

item.title: Catch the Wave
item.description: I thank God and His Son, Jesus Christ, for the Restoration and its power to propel a magnificent wave of truth and righteousness across the earth.

item.title: Listening to True Prophets
item.description: Elder Hales teaches about listening to true prophets (D&C 136:34-36).

item.title: Stand Strong in Holy Places
item.description: Standing obedient and strong on the doctrine of our God, we stand in holy places, for His doctrine is sacred and will not change.

item.description: The 2017 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional with music provided by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and the Orchestra at Temple Square.

item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Hark, All Ye Nations!”

item.description: As daughters of God we are each unique and different in our circumstances and experiences. And yet our part matters—because we matter.

item.title: Gyanu Dulal—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Gyanu Dulal, a community resource specialist for the Department of Workforce Services, talks about his experience working with LDS Charities.

item.title: Atem Aleu—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Atem Aleu talks about his experience working with LDS Charities.

item.title: Patrick Poulin—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Patrick Poulin talks about his experience working with LDS Charities.

item.title: Behind the Scenes: Ogden Peach Orchard
item.description: We went to the Church’s peach orchard in Ogden to find out a little bit more about Church farms and where the food goes.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Monica Scott
item.description: Monica Scott plays her original song "For Coey" on the piano accompanied by Sarah Arnesen on the cello. "For Coey" was written for the funeral of a friends son.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Renshaw
item.description: The four-man band Renshaw stopped by Mormon Channel Studio to perform their original song “It’s Alright,” along with the hymn “There Is a Green Hill Far Away.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Kimberly Knighton
item.description: Mormon Channel Studio is a weekly video series featuring beautiful hymn arrangements and original music by LDS musicians from across the nation.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Trio Los Charros
item.description: Mariachi band Trio Los Charros visit the studio to record several of their favorite songs. All three of the band members have roots in Mexico and so do the songs they perform: “La Malagueña,” “La Petenera,” and “La Cigarra.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Adelaide Kaufusi
item.description: When Adelaide Kaufusi was invited to perform on Mormon Channel Studio, she knew she wanted to share her twin sister’s lyrics with all of you. According to Adelaide, her sister’s music often goes unheard.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Fabiana Lauf
item.description: Fabiana Lauf and her bandmates came to Mormon Channel Studio to perform her original song, “Hoch Hinaus” in German and the hymn “Lead Kindly Light” in Spanish.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Jennifer Blosil
item.description: Jennifer Blosil is well-known for appearing on a national singing competition and she has a growing fan base. So when it comes to personal relationships, Jen doesn’t settle for anything that isn’t real.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Aubree Liz
item.description: Aubree Liz visited Mormon Channel Studio to perform her original song “Teeth,” followed by her rendition of the hymn “Brightly Beams Our Father’s Mercy.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Molly in the Mineshaft
item.description: "All Creatures of Our God and King" and "Fair Maid" sung by Molly in the Mineshaft.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Jason Lyle Black
item.description: Music doesn’t always need lyrics in order to speak. Jason Lyle Black came to Mormon Channel Studio to perform a few of his piano arrangements, including two original songs and a classic hymn.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - David Lindes
item.description: "Forgiving others daily for small things may sound doable. What about forgiving the worst offenses, though? How do you make peace with a lion? That’s the question David Lindes asks in his original song “Peace with a Lion.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Monica Moore Smith
item.description: Monica Moore Smith stopped by Mormon Channel Studio to perform a few of her favorite songs, including a jazz ballad called “Look Up.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Just PPL
item.description: Just PPL is a musical group comprised of friends who come from different backgrounds and belief systems. Their differences complement the harmonies they create together.

item.title: Teaching Kids How to Disagree Without Being Disagreeable
item.description: “It is appropriate to disagree, but it is not appropriate to be disagreeable,” teaches Quentin L. Cook.

item.title: Making the Gospel Relevant for Our Youth
item.description: Making the gospel relevant for our youth.

item.title: Strengthening Our Kids for the Last Days
item.description: This is a generation that is preparing for the return of our Savior and preparing to carry on his kingdom during the millennium. Are these kids the chosen or the royal generation?

item.title: How to Talk to a Friend or Family Member Who Is Grieving
item.description: How have you comforted those who are experiencing loss themselves? Sister Reyna I. Aburto, second counselor in the Relief Society General Presidency, and Kevin Brodrick, licensed marriage and family therapist, offer their advice in this interview.

item.title: How to Teach Your Kids that Scripture Power is Real
item.description: Are the kids excited or groaning when its time for family scripture study? We want our children to know that the scriptures are a real power in their lives.

item.title: How to Teach Your Kids About the Joy and Importance of Parenthood
item.description: Parenthood is the perhaps the most important and challenging role we can fill in this life. It is also the most rewarding. Do our kids see it that way?

item.title: How to Foster Feelings of Belonging Within Ourselves and Others
item.description: Everyone wants to feel like they belong, and God and Jesus Christ want everyone to know that they certainly do. So what can we do when we or those we care about feel isolated or ignored?

item.title: How a Happy Marriage Makes for Better Parenting
item.description: When it comes to raising happy, healthy children, it can be easy to forget that focusing on the health of your marriage is a key component.

item.title: I Stand All Amazed
item.description: As we ponder the life of Jesus Christ, we will come to know that His sacrifice for us is deeply personal and truly wonderful. BYU’s Vocal Point sings “I Stand All Amazed” in tribute to the mission of the Savior.

item.title: A Good Samaritan
item.description: If we will open our hearts to the possibility of providing compassionate service to others, the Lord will bless us to recognize and respond to the opportunities we’re given daily to become modern-day good Samaritans.

item.title: Am I Good Enough?
item.description: If you will really try and will not rationalize or rebel—repenting often and pleading for grace—you positively are going to be “good enough.”

item.title: Tamisha’s Job
item.description: A woman shares how her self-reliance group helped her find purpose and faith during a job search and career transition.

item.title: Thy Friends Do Stand by Thee
item.description: Elder Ronald A. Rasband received invaluable mentoring from his boss when he was a young salesman.

item.title: The Perpetual Education Fund Today
item.description: Since 2001, the Perpetual Education Fund (PEF) has been a great blessing to thousands of Church members. This video outlines how the PEF operates today as part of the Church’s self-reliance efforts.

item.title: Samuel the Lamanite's prophecy fulfilled
item.description: The signs of the Savior's birth are manifest according to the prophesy of of Samuel the Lamanite (3 Nephi 1:1–15).

item.title: Act in Faith: The Stonemason
item.description: When a doctrine or teaching doesn't fit into the rock wall of our testimony, do we abandon the wall and walk away?

item.title: Start Small. Start Today.
item.description: By small things, great things happen.

item.title: Think to Thank
item.description: Thinking to thank God brings us all these things, draws us closer to those we love, and makes us more like the Savior.

item.title: Think to Thank
item.description: Who will you thank God for today?

category.title: 2017 Light the World: 25 Days of Service
category.subtitle: Videos: 26

item.title: #LightTheWorld: A Christmas Message from Mormon.org
item.description: This Christmas season, how will you #LightTheWorld? Start today at mormon.org to learn how you can be like the Savior, Jesus Christ. Serve as He did helping light the way for others. Learn more at mormon.org.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 1: Light the World—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 10:8 says, “Freely ye have received, freely give.” Visit mormon.org to find out how you can give back and light the world this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 2: Healing Waters—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 25:35: “I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink.” Healing Waters International provides clean water to people in need. Visit mormon.org to learn how you can #LightTheWorld this Christmas season.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 3: The Sabbath Day—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 12:12 says, “Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.” Visit mormon.org to find out ways that you can do well this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 4: Love Thy Neighbour—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 22:39 says, “Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.” Visit mormon.org to learn how you can #LightTheWorld by helping your neighbor.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 5: Honour Thy Father and Mother—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 15:4 says, “Honour thy father and mother.” Visit mormon.org to find ways you can honor your father and mother this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 6: Judge Not—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 7:1 says, “Judge not, that ye be not judged.” Visit mormon.org to find ways to avoid passing judgment this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 7: Suffer the Little Children—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Mark 10:14 says, “Suffer the little children to come unto me.” Visit mormon.org to find new ways to spend quality time with your children this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 8: Love Your Enemies—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 5:44 says, “Love your enemies.” Visit mormon.org to find ways that you can love your enemies this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 9: Elizabeth Edwards’s Story—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 25:36: “I was sick, and ye visited me.” Elizabeth Edwards’s friends followed the teachings of Jesus Christ. Visit mormon.org to know how you can #LightTheWorld this Christmas season.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 10: Search the Scriptures—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: John 5:39 says, “Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life.” Visit mormon.org to find ways that you can search the scriptures this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 11: I Was a Stranger—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 25:35: “I was a stranger, and ye took me in.” Chelsee and Jenny made a stranger a part of their family. Visit mormon.org to learn how you can #LightTheWorld this Christmas season.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 12: Jon and Michelle Schmidt’s Story—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 5:4: “Blessed are they that mourn.” Jon and Michelle Schmidt felt comfort through the love of others. Visit mormon.org to learn how you can #LightTheWorld this Christmas season.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 13: Helping Those in Need – Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 7:12 says “All things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them”. Visit Mormon.org to find ways that you can help those in need this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 14: Life’s True Treasures—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 6:21 says, “For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.” Visit mormon.org this Christmas season to learn more about how life’s true treasures can’t be bought. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 15: Merciful—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 5:7 says, “Blessed are the merciful.” Visit mormon.org to find ways you can be more merciful this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 16: Clothing Donations—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 25:36 says, “[I was] naked, and ye clothed me.” Visit mormon.org to find ways you can donate clothes to those in need this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 17: Being Together—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: 3 Nephi 18:22 says, “Ye shall meet together oft.” Visit mormon.org to find ways to spend time together this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 18: Forgiveness—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 6:14 says, “Forgive men their trespasses.” Visit mormon.org to find ways to help you forgive someone this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 19: Aaron Jepson’s Story—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 5:12: “Rejoice, and be exceeding glad.” Aaron Jepson lives by the words of Jesus Christ. Visit mormon.org to learn how you can #LightTheWorld this Christmas season.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 20: A Man’s Life—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Luke 12:15 says, “A man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.” Visit mormon.org this Christmas season to find ways to appreciate the things that matter in life. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 21: Feed the Hungry—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 25:35 says, “For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat.” Visit mormon.org to find ways that you can help feed the hungry this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 22: Ray Flores’s Story—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: 3 Nephi 27:21: “That which ye have seen me do even that shall ye do.” Ray Flores follows the example of Jesus Christ by serving others. Visit mormon.org to learn how you can #LightTheWorld this Christmas season.

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 23: Prisoner—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Matthew 25:36 says, “I was in prison, and ye came unto me.” Visit mormon.org to find ways to help those in need this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 24: Prayer—Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: 3 Nephi 18:15 says, “Ye must watch and pray always.” Visit mormon.org to find ways that you can involve prayer in your life this Christmas season. #LightTheWorld

item.title: #LightTheWorld Day 25: How others helped “light the world” – Mormon.org Christmas 2017
item.description: Watch how we all celebrated this Christmas season through #LightTheWorld as we all served others. Visit Mormon.org to learn more. #LightTheWorld

item.title: And a Little Child Shall Lead Them
item.description: Husbands and wives should understand that their first calling—from which they will never be released—is to one another and then to their children.

item.title: Tuning Our Hearts to the Voice of the Spirit
item.description: March 2, 2014: Sister Linda K. Burton shares insights to help increase the listener’s ability to recognize the voice of the spirit.

item.title: Converted unto the Lord
item.description: Knowing that the gospel is true is the essence of a testimony. Consistently being true to the gospel is the essence of conversion.

item.title: One Step Closer to the Savior
item.description: Conversion is the goal of all gospel learning and teaching. Conversion is not a onetime event. It is a lifelong quest to become more like the Savior.

item.title: Be Still, My Soul
item.description: When life seems to fall apart and hope seems to disappear, let your soul be still and remember that God never leaves you.

item.title: Perfect Love Casteth Out Fear
item.description: If you will respond to the invitation to share your beliefs and feelings about the restored gospel of Jesus Christ, a spirit of love and a spirit of courage will be your constant companion.

item.title: Be Valiant in Courage, Strength, and Activity
item.description: Qualify yourselves as did the 2,000 stripling soldiers by being valiant in courage as worthy priesthood holders.

item.title: Be of a Good Courage
item.description: [The] guides from the book of Joshua will combine to provide the most powerful source of courage and strength there is: faith in our Heavenly Father and in His Son, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Dare to Stand Alone
item.description: May we ever be courageous and prepared to stand for what we believe.

item.title: Cleave unto the Covenants
item.description: As we have faith in Christ and cleave unto our covenants, we will receive the joy spoken of in the holy scriptures and promised by our latter-day prophets.

item.title: Covenants
item.description: When we realize that we are children of the covenant, we know who we are and what God expects of us.

item.title: Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Rather than being judgmental and critical of each other, may we have the pure love of Christ for our fellow travelers in this journey through life.

item.title: Becoming a True Disciple
item.description: As we obey His commandments and serve our fellowmen, we become better disciples of Jesus Christ.

item.title: If Ye Are Prepared Ye Shall Not Fear
item.description: We do live in turbulent times. Often the future is unknown; therefore, it behooves us to prepare for uncertainties.

item.title: Personal and Family Financial Preparedness
item.description: Elder Franklin D. Richards delivers a message titled "Personal and Family Financial Preparedness."

item.title: Spiritual Preparedness: Start Early and Be Steady
item.description: The great test of life is to see whether we will hearken to and obey God’s commands in the midst of the storms of life.
